topProducts.name: Coffee/Latte
topProducts.description: Superb, excellent, tasty, and delicious, often enjoyed for casual brunch. Includes variations like lavender, maple, and dirty chai lattes.

topProducts.name: Fish Tacos
topProducts.description: Described as 'the best ever,' light, delicately-balanced, fresh, flavorful, and incredible.
quotes: I went to Common Roots cafe for brunch today, and I was blown away by the fish tacos
Had a beer, cookie and fish tacos and couldn't ask for anything more

topProducts.name: Bagels
topProducts.description: Praised as the 'best bagels in Minnesota.'
quotes: I just have to say, you have the best bagels in Minnesota
Also the everything bagels are drool-worthy

topProducts.name: Tempeh Sandwich
topProducts.description: An 'absolutely delicious' sandwich that is highly recommended.
quotes: Very lovely cafe, I had the tempeh sandwich and garlic fries

topProducts.name: Garlic Fries
topProducts.description: Described as 'absolutely delicious,' often enjoyed as a side dish.
quotes: Very lovely cafe, I had the tempeh sandwich and garlic fries

topProducts.name: Shakshuka
topProducts.description: A savory breakfast or brunch dish, mentioned as 'pictured' in reviews.
quotes: Pictured: Shakshuka, Small Hot Mocha, Large Hot Salted Caramel
My husband had Shakshuka which was delicious as well

topProducts.name: Scone
topProducts.description: Described as 'great,' often enjoyed with coffee, with a specific mention of a 'plum scone.'
quotes: I had the lavender latte and plum scone, both were great
Common Roots is the best place to grab a coffee & scone and it also is a great place for breakfast and lunch

highlightedReviews.author: Shannon Mahedy
highlightedReviews.text: Wow! I went to Common Roots cafe for brunch today, and I was blown away by the fish tacos. They were, without a doubt, the best fish tacos I’ve ever had! They were light, delicately-balanced, fresh, and flavorful. Each bite was incredible, and I found myself telling my friend how delicious they were over and over while I devoured my tacos. The chips and salsa on the side were excellent too, and the salsa was definitely house-made. My only wish were that there were more tacos on my plate. I’ll be back for more tacos soon! I’m very impressed by this dish!

highlightedReviews.author: Aishwarya Murali
highlightedReviews.text: I had a wild rice burger and it was so good! The burger was perfectly seasoned and the tortilla chips that came with it was fantastic. My husband had Shakshuka which was delicious as well. We ordered some bakery items - Pineapple coconut quick bread and cherry scone. It was so yummy! When I went back to order some more bakery goods the restaurant had closed already. But they were very sweet and they gave the pineapple coconut cake for free. It was such a sweet gesture! I highly recommend this place. The food is very fresh and it’s locally sourced/organic which is just a cherry on top.

highlightedReviews.author: jesse james johnson
highlightedReviews.text: I love the focus of the local spending this place does and they also have an awesome catering shop that I've been able to check out at some heavy table events. While in recent years I feel like they've moved away from their adventurous menus, perhaps, since I'm a regular customer I've become unadventurous when eating there but the food quality has remained top notch. Common Roots is the best place to grab a coffee & scone and it also is a great place for breakfast and lunch. I'd really like it if more items could be made vegan. I don't come here nearly as often as I once did because a lot of items that could be vegan just don't have that option.

highlightedReviews.author: Ozzie Valverde
highlightedReviews.text: I came here for Burger Night and man.... those burgers do not disappoint! Will definitely be coming back to try out their specialty burgers. The drinks and service are also top notch. This place is the antithesis to CC Club. Organic, inclusive, and actually cares about the community. highly recommend

highlightedReviews.author: Jess Sharpe
highlightedReviews.text: Common Roots catered dinner for our small Covid-friendly wedding. They did a contactless drop off, and the instructions for assembling the chafing dishes were clear and easy to follow. All the plates and utensils they provide are compostable, so they make it possible to have a very low-waste event. The food was great, generally (maybe skip the green beans, as they weren’t memorable, but the lasagna, grilled chicken with pineapple salsa, and rice pilaf were great, and the coconut macaroons are enormous), and they even supplied trash bins and compostable bags to collect all the food and plates/utensils. They came the next day to pick everything up, including the compost, which was so convenient. They also answered our endless questions about details. A great experience!

highlightedReviews.author: Daily dose
highlightedReviews.text:
Very serene experience, the outdoor patio is perfect during the fall.
The food options are many and everything we ordered was great!
I’d just be wary when siting outside, we ordered pancakes and we couldn’t finish them because we were “literally attacked by bees!

Other than that, I’d go back again for sure.

highlightedReviews.author: Casey Lee
highlightedReviews.text: Not only does Common Roots provide amazing food, but their service is top-notch. All of our guests told us how much they enjoyed the appetizers, dinner, and snacks. We had such a positive experience working with Tiffany throughout our planning process. When the pandemic hit Minnesota, the Common Roots Catering team was flexible and very helpful as we had to replan most of our wedding. The day of catering team also did a great job dropping off the food and helping set up the quickly.

highlightedReviews.author: Lynx Cheam
highlightedReviews.text:
Good times were had. Service was great. As part of my first time out to MN, I would say this place is easily worth the visit.

When done with meal, you bus yourself. Keep that in mind, they don't spoil you here with service of that level, but instead exchange it for delicious food and tasty coffee.

Pictured: Shakshuka, Small Hot Mocha, Large Hot Salted Caramel

highlightedReviews.author: Becca Schilling
highlightedReviews.text:
We love Common Roots Cafe, and had them cater for our wedding. The food was absolutely *delicious*. Everyone loved it, and I still think about that turkey at least once a week. They went above and beyond with the planning process leading up to the wedding, and were so incredibly helpful and thoughtful. I loved getting to work with them, and cannot stress how much I appreciated all they did for us!

I have dietary restrictions, and we selected passed apps for cocktail hour that I couldn't eat. They asked me ahead of time if I would like them to make a couple things special for me and I told them not worry about it as I'd have plenty of food shortly after for dinner time. They flagged me down during cocktail hour with a plate of specially made appetizers just for me. And I don't mean, like, a simple veggie tray or something. They specifically went out of their way to make a few gluten free and dairy free versions of the tarts we were serving guests, just for me. Unbelievable service and care.

Amazing food, and incredible employees. We highly recommend both their catering and their cafe!

highlightedReviews.author: Karen Lunde
highlightedReviews.text:
Common Roots Café, at 2558 Lyndale Ave S, offers great food and beverages, including at least four (4) Fair Trade products. These include Fair Trade Bananas and Fair Trade Sugar from Equal Exchange, Black Squirrel Espresso roasted by Peace Coffee, and Rishi Jasmine Green Tea.

Thank you for helping to eliminate poverty & protect the environment by selling Fair Trade products, and welcome to Fair Trade Minneapolis!
